info.title: Camunda Platform REST API
info.description: OpenApi Spec for Camunda Platform REST API.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Camunda Rest API

servers.description: The API server for the default process engine
The API server for a named process engine
The API server with a custom url

get.description:
Queries for batches that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the properties of batches, such as the id or type.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Batch Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/batch/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: Filter by batch id.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter by batch type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`. A batch matches if it has one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include batches which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether only active or suspended batches should be included.
When the value is set to `true`, only suspended batches will be returned and
when the value is set to `false`, only active batches will be returned.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description:

400.description:

delete.description:
Deletes a batch by id, including all related jobs and job definitions.
Optionally also deletes the batch history.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the batch to be deleted.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description: `true`, if the historic batch and historic job logs for this batch should also be deleted.

400.description:
Batch with given id does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a batch by id, according to the Batch interface in the engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the batch to be retrieved.

404.description:
Batch with given id does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

put.description: Activates or suspends a batch by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the batch to activate or suspend.

400.description:
Returned if the batch cannot be suspended or activated.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Triggers evaluation of conditions for conditional start event(s). 
Internally this maps to the engines condition evaluation builder method ConditionEvaluationBuilder#evaluateStartConditions(). 
For more information see the [Conditional Start Events](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/bpmn20/events/conditional-events/#conditional-start-event)
section of the [BPMN 2.0 Implementation Reference](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/bpmn20/).

example-1.description: The content of the Request Body
The Response content of a status 200

400.description: If both tenantId and withoutTenantId are supplied.

403.description: If the user is not allowed to start the process instance of the process definition, which start condition was evaluated to `true`.

get.description:
Queries for decision definitions that fulfill given parameters.
Parameters may be the properties of decision definitions, such as the name, key or version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using
the [Get Decision Definition Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/decision-definition/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition id.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition key, i.e., the id in the DMN 1.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those decision definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: withoutDecisionRequirementsDefinition
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which does not belongs to any decision requirements definition.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeDecisionDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tags of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.description: The key of the decision definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

get.description: Returns the diagram for the latest version of the decision definition which belongs to no tenant

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the decision definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

200.description: Request successful. The image diagram of this process.

schema.description: defaults to `application/octet-stream` if the file suffix is unknown
Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

204.description: The decision definition doesn't have an associated diagram.

404.description:
Decision definition with given key does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Evaluates the latest version of the decision definition which belongs to no tenant.
The input values of the decision have to be supplied in the request body.

404.description:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                                    <definitions xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20151101/dmn.xsd"
                                                 id="definitions"
                                                 name="camunda"
                                                 namespace="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/dmn">
                                      <decision id="testDecision" name="decision">
                                        <decisionTable id="table">
                                          <output id="result" name="result" >
                                          </output>
                                          <rule id="rule">
                                            <outputEntry id="output1">
                                              <text>"not okay"</text>
                                            </outputEntry>
                                          </rule>
                                        </decisionTable>
                                      </decision>
                                    </definitions>

get.description:
Queries for deployments that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the properties of deployments,
such as the id or name or a range of the deployment time. The size of the result set can be retrieved by
using the [Get Deployment count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/deployment/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment name. Exact match.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the deployment name that the parameter is a substring of. The parameter can include the
wildcard `%` to express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or contains
(`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source.

parameters.name: withoutSource
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source whereby source is equal to `null`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A deployment must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include deployments which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: includeDeploymentsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include deployments which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of deployments that fulfill given parameters. Takes the same parameters as the
[Get Deployments](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/deployment/get-query/) method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment name. Exact match.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the deployment name that the parameter is a substring of. The parameter can include the
wildcard `%` to express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or contains
(`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source.

parameters.name: withoutSource
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source whereby source is equal to `null`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A deployment must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include deployments which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: includeDeploymentsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include deployments which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example, if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Creates a deployment.

**Security Consideration**

Deployments can contain custom code in form of scripts or EL expressions to customize process behavior.
This may be abused for remote execution of arbitrary code.

value.message: ENGINE-09005 Could not parse BPMN process. Errors: Exclusive Gateway 'ExclusiveGateway_1' has outgoing sequence flow 'SequenceFlow_0' without condition which is not the default flow.

errors.message: Exclusive Gateway 'ExclusiveGateway_1' has outgoing sequence flow 'SequenceFlow_0' without condition which is not the default flow.

warnings.message: It is not recommended to use a cancelling boundary timer event with a time cycle.

400.description:
Bad Request. In case one of the bpmn resources cannot be parsed.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#parse-exceptions) for
the error response format.

delete.description: Deletes a deployment by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment to be deleted.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description:
`true`, if all process instances, historic process instances and jobs for this deployment
should be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: `true`, if only the built-in ExecutionListeners should be notified with the end event.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description: `true`, if all input/output mappings should not be invoked.

404.description:
A Deployment with the provided id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a deployment by id, according to the `Deployment` interface of the engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment.

404.description:
Deployment with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Re-deploys an existing deployment.

The deployment resources to re-deploy can be restricted by using the properties `resourceIds` or
`resourceNames`. If no deployment resources to re-deploy are passed then all existing resources of the
given deployment are re-deployed.

**Warning**: Deployments can contain custom code in form of scripts or EL expressions to customize
process behavior. This may be abused for remote execution of arbitrary code. See the section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/) in
the user guide for details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment to re-deploy.

404.description:
Deployment or a deployment resource for the given deployment does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves all deployment resources of a given deployment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment to retrieve the deployment resources for.

404.description:
Deployment resources for the given deployment do not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a deployment resource by resource id for the given deployment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The id of the deployment resource

404.description:
Deployment Resource with given resource id or deployment id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves the binary content of a deployment resource for the given deployment by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The id of the deployment resource.

200.description: Request successful. The media type of the response depends on the filename.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. For example, a
                            `process.bpmn` resource will have the media type `application/xml`.

400.description:
Deployment Resource with given resource id or deployment id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the names of all process engines available on your platform.
**Note**: You cannot prepend `/engine/{name}` to this method.

Queries for event subscriptions that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Event Subscriptions count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/event-subscription/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: eventSubscriptionId
parameters.description: Only select subscription with the given id.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions for events with the given name.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description:
Only select subscriptions for events with the given type.
Valid values: `message`, `signal`, `compensate` and `conditional`.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
Only select subscriptions that belong to one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only select subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeEventSubscriptionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Select event subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Can be used in combination with tenantIdIn parameter.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the executions that fulfill given parameters.
Parameters may be static as well as dynamic runtime properties of
executions.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get
Execution Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/execution/get-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: businessKey
parameters.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

parameters.name: signalEventSubscriptionName
parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

parameters.name: messageEventSubscriptionName
parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that have variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: processVariables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables with certain
values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for executions that fulfill given parameters through a JSON object.
This method is slightly more powerful than the [Get
Executions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/execution/get-query/) method
because it allows
to filter by multiple instance and execution variables of types
`String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for the number of executions that fulfill given parameters. This method
takes the same message body as the [Get Executions

Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/execution/get-query-count/) method.

get.description:
Retrieves an execution by id, according to the `Execution` interface in the
engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to be retrieved.

404.description:
Execution with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Creates a custom incident with given properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to create a new incident for.

400.description:
Returned if the incident type is null, the execution does not exist or the
execution is not related to any activity.

get.description: Retrieves all variables of a given execution by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically
variables that store custom Java objects) should be deserialized
on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on
server side and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java
classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its
serialized format. For example, a variable that is serialized as
XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of
backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to
`false` when developing web applications that are independent of
the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. Returns A JSON object of variables key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a VariableValueDto

500.description:
Execution with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables in the context of an execution by id. The updates
do not propagate upwards in the execution hierarchy.
Updates precede deletions. So, if a variable is updated AND deleted,
the deletion overrides the update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to set variables for.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-
handling) for the error response format.

500.description:
Update or delete could not be executed, for example because the execution does not
exist.

delete.description:
Deletes a variable in the context of a given execution by id. Deletion does not
propagate upwards in the execution hierarchy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to delete the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to delete.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

get.description:
Retrieves a variable from the context of a given execution by id. Does not traverse
the parent execution hierarchy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to retrieve the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to get.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically
variables that store custom Java objects) should be deserialized
on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on
server side and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java
classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.
If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its
serialized format. For example, a variable that is serialized as
XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of
backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to
`false` when developing web applications that are independent of
the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description:
Sets a variable in the context of a given execution by id. Update does not
propagate upwards in the execution hierarchy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to set the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-
handling) for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a binary variable from the context of a given execution by id. Does not
traverse the parent execution hierarchy. Applicable for byte array and
file variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to retrieve the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to get.

200.description:
Request successful.
        For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
        File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
            Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

example-1.value: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="someFile.txt"

400.description:
Variable instance with given id exists but is not a binary variable. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Variable instance with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the serialized value for a binary variable or the binary value for a file
variable in the context of a given execution by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to set the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

example-1.summary: Post binary content of a byte array variable
example-1.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="unspecified"
                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y--
                        ```

example-2.summary: Post the JSON serialization of a Java Class **(deprecated)**
example-2.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"
                        Content-Type: application/json; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo", "bar"]
                        ```

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if no filename is set. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a message event subscription for a given execution by id and a message
name.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution that holds the subscription.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message that the subscription corresponds to.

404.description:
A message subscription for the given name and execution does not exist.
This may either mean that the execution does not exist, or that
it is not subscribed on such a message.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Delivers a message to a specific execution by id, to trigger an existing message
event subscription. Inject process variables as the message's
payload.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to submit the message to.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message that the addressed subscription corresponds to.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

500.description:
The addressed execution has no pending message subscriptions for the given message.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Signals an execution by id. Can for example be used to explicitly skip user tasks
or signal asynchronous continuations.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to signal.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the external tasks that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be static as well as dynamic
runtime properties of executions. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get External Task Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/external-task/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: externalTaskId
parameters.description: Filter by an external task's id.

parameters.name: externalTaskIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

parameters.name: topicName
parameters.description: Filter by an external task topic.

parameters.name: workerId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: notLocked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

parameters.name: lockExpirationAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: lockExpirationBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the activity that an external task is created for.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of ids of the activities that an external task is created for.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the execution that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process instance that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids that an external task may belong to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process definition that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
An external task must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for external tasks that fulfill given parameters in the form of a JSON object.

This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get External Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/external-task/get-query/) method because it allows to
specify a hierarchical result sorting.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

200.description: Request successful. The Response is a JSON array of external task objects.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:

body as the [Get External Tasks (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/external-task/post-query/) method.

400.description:

post.description:
Fetches and locks a specific number of external tasks for execution by a worker. Query can be restricted
to specific task topics and for each task topic an individual lock time can be provided.

400.description:
Bad Request. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description:
Sets the number of retries left to execute external tasks by id synchronously. If retries are set to 0, 
an incident is created.

400.description:
In case the number of retries is negative or null, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is
returned. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task, 
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the number of retries left to execute external tasks by id asynchronously. If retries are set to 0,
an incident is created.

400.description:
If neither externalTaskIds nor externalTaskQuery are present or externalTaskIds contains null value or 
the number of retries is negative or null, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for distinct topic names of external tasks that fulfill given parameters.
Query can be restricted to only tasks with retries left, tasks that are locked, or tasks
that are unlocked. The parameters withLockedTasks and withUnlockedTasks are
exclusive. Setting them both to true will return an empty list.
Providing no parameters will return a list of all distinct topic names with external tasks.

parameters.name: withLockedTasks
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withUnlockedTasks
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

individual group instances. The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that
the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/group` resource. If the user can perform an operation
or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

The `/group` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, one for the resource as such and this one for individual group instances.
The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that the currently authenticated user can perform on the
`/group/{id}` resource instance. If the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations
to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group.

put.description: Updates a given group by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group.

403.description: Identity service is read-only (Cannot modify users / groups / memberships).

404.description: If the group with the requested Id cannot be found.

500.description:
The group could not be updated due to an internal server error.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error
response format.

things, including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and the internal configuration
of the process engine.

parameters.description:

parameters.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given process instance. Takes a process instance id.

parameters.name: subProcessInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict query to one process instance that has a sub process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: superCaseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance. Takes a case instance id.

parameters.name: subCaseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict query to one process instance that has a sub case instance with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance. Takes a case instance id.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include historic process instances which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: executedActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that executed an activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: activeActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that have an active activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are active.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are suspended.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

parameters.name: externallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

parameters.name: internallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

parameters.name: externallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

parameters.name: internallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for the number of historic process instances that fulfill the given parameters.
This method takes the same message body as the [Get Process Instances (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/history/process-instance/get-process-instance-query/) method and
therefore it is slightly more powerful than the [Get Process Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/history/process-instance/post-process-instance-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Delete multiple historic process instances asynchronously (batch).
At least `historicProcessInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery` has to be provided.
If both are provided then all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list will be deleted.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, i.e. neither historicProcessInstanceIds,
nor historicProcessInstanceQuery is present. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about the duration of completed process instances, grouped by a period.
These reports include the maximum, minimum and average duration of all completed process instances which were started in a given period.

**Note:** This only includes historic data.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description:
**Mandatory.** Specifies the type of the report to retrieve.
To retrieve a report about the duration of process instances, the value must be set to `duration`.

parameters.name: periodUnit
parameters.description: **Mandatory.** Specifies the granularity of the report. Valid values are `month` and `quarter`.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date.
By [default](), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid or mandatory parameters are not supplied.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to read the history.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic process instances asynchronously (batch).

At least `historicProcessInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery` has to be provided.
If both are provided, all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Bad Request
Request was unsuccessfull due to a bad user request. This occurs if some of the query parameters are invalid,
e. g. if neither `historicProcessInstances` nor `historicProcessInstanceQuery` is present or if no mode is specified.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

delete.description: Deletes a process instance from the history by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic process instance to be deleted.

parameters.name: failIfNotExists
parameters.description: If set to `false`, the request will still be successful if the process id is not found.

404.description:
Not found
Historic process instance with given id does not exist.

get.description: Retrieves a historic process instance by id, according to the `HistoricProcessInstance` interface in the engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic process instance to be retrieved.

404.description:
Not Found
Historic process instance with given id does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

delete.description: Deletes all variables of a process instance from the history by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance for which all historic variables are to be deleted.

404.description:
Not found
Historic process instance with given id does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#parse-exceptions) for the error response format.

get.description:
Gets the groups of a user by id and includes all users that share a group with the
given user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The id of the user to get the groups for.

400.description:
If the `userId` query parameter is missing. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. This end point returns a JSON representation of the
list of policy rules. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length,
and some complexity rules.

404.description: No password policy was found.

post.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. A password can be checked for compliancy via this
end point. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length, and
some complexity rules. The checked password is myPassword which is not complex enough to match all of
the policy rules.

404.description: No password policy was found to check the password against.

post.description: Verifies that user credentials are valid.

400.description: If body does not contain username or password.

get.description:
Queries for incidents that fulfill given parameters. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using
the [Get Incident Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/incident/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident
types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value. The string can include
the wildcard character '%' to express like-strategy: starts with (`string%`), ends with (`%string`) or
contains (`%string%`).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given keys. Must be a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date before the given date. By default, the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date after the given date. By default*, the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that were created due to the failure of an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: causeIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as cause incident.

parameters.name: rootCauseIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as root cause incident.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as configuration.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated job definition ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error
response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of incidents that fulfill given parameters. Takes the same parameters as the
[Get Incidents](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/incident/get-query/) method.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident
types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value. The string can include
the wildcard character '%' to express like-strategy: starts with (`string%`), ends with (`%string`) or
contains (`%string%`).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given keys. Must be a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date before the given date. By default, the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date after the given date. By default*, the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that were created due to the failure of an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: causeIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as cause incident.

parameters.name: rootCauseIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as root cause incident.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as configuration.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated job definition ids.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error
response format.

delete.description: Resolves an incident with given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to be resolved.

404.description: Returned if an incident with given id does not exist.

400.description:
Returned if an incident is not related to any execution or an incident is of type `failedJob` or
`failedExternalTask`. To resolve such an incident, please refer to the
[Incident Types](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) section.

get.description: Retrieves an incident by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to be retrieved.

404.description: Returned if an incident with given id does not exist.

delete.description: Clears the annotation of an incident with given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to clear the annotation at.

400.description: Returned if no incident can be found for the given id.

put.description: Sets the annotation of an incident with given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to clear the annotation at.

400.description: Returned if no incident can be found for the given id.

get.description:
Queries for jobs that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get Job
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/job/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Filter by job id.

parameters.name: jobIds
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of job ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given job definition.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given process instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceIds
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given comma-separated list of process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given execution.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: executable
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which are executable, i.e., retries > 0 and due date is `null` or due
date is in the past. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: timers
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are timers. Cannot be used together with `messages`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are messages. Cannot be used together with `timers`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: dueDates
parameters.description:
Only select jobs where the due date is lower or higher than the given date.
Due date expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: createTimes
parameters.description:
Only select jobs created before or after the given date.

Create time expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: withException
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that failed due to an exception. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is
the default behavior.

parameters.name: exceptionMessage
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception with the given message.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception at an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have no retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Only include jobs which belong to one of the passed comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include jobs which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: includeJobsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include jobs which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for due date comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for jobs that fulfill given parameters. This method is slightly more
powerful than the [Get Jobs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/job/get-query/)
method because it allows filtering by multiple jobs of types `String`,
`Number` or `Boolean`.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for due date comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a

parameters.name: tenantIdIn

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:

parameters.description:

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example, if an invalid operator
for due date comparison is used. See the
