parameters.name: assigneeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression is assigned to. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: assigneeLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter value described by the 
given expression as a substring. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are assigned to one of the passed and 
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

parameters.name: ownerExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression owns. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateGroup
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given group.

parameters.name: candidateGroupExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the group described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateUser
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given user or to one of his groups.

parameters.name: candidateUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the user described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: includeAssignedTasks
parameters.description:
Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only 
include tasks that are not assigned to any user if you query by candidate user or
group(s).

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

parameters.name: involvedUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have one of the given keys. The keys need to be in a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a key that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

parameters.name: nameNotEqual
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that do not have the given name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

parameters.name: nameNotLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that do not have a name with the given parameter
value as substring.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

parameters.name: descriptionLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter
value as a substring.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

parameters.name: maxPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a lower or equal priority.

parameters.name: minPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a higher or equal priority.

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: dueDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the date described by the given expression. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.435+0200`.

parameters.name: dueAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.243+0200`.

parameters.name: dueBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: withoutDueDate
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: followUpDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.542+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.234+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistent
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.432+0200`. The
typical use case is to query all `active` tasks for a user for a given date.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistentExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the date
described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.324+0200`.

parameters.name: createdOnExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: createdAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: createdBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: delegationState
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are in the given delegation state. Valid values are
`PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

parameters.name: candidateGroups
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the given candidate groups. Takes a
comma-separated list of group names, so for example `developers,support,sales`.

parameters.name: candidateGroupsExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the candidate groups described by the
given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to
`java.util.List` of Strings.

parameters.name: withCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate user. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate users. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: taskVariables
processVariables
caseInstanceVariables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableName` and `variablename` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableValue` and `variablevalue` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all tasks that are sub tasks of the given task. Takes a task id.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Retrieves the number of tasks that fulfill the given filter. Corresponds to the size
of the result set of the [Get Tasks (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/task/post-query/)
method and takes the same parameters.

**Security Consideration**:
There are several parameters (such as `assigneeExpression`) for specifying an EL
expression. These are disabled by default to prevent remote code execution. See the
section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
in the user guide for details.

example-2.description: Logical query: assignee = "John Munda" AND (name = "Approve Invoice" OR priority = 5) AND (suspended = false OR taskDefinitionKey = "approveInvoice")

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Creates a new task.

value.name: My Task
value.description: This have to be done very urgent

400.description:
Returned if a not valid `delegationState` is supplied. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

delete.description: Removes a task by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to be removed.

400.description:
Bad Request. The Task with the given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

500.description:
The Task with the given id cannot be deleted because it is part of a running process or case instance.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a task by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to be retrieved.

404.description:
Task with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description: Updates a task.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to be updated.

value.name: My Task
value.description: This have to be done very urgent

400.description:
Returned if a not valid `delegationState` is supplied. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description: If the corresponding task cannot be found.

post.description:
Changes the assignee of a task to a specific user.

**Note:** The difference with the [Claim Task](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/task/post-claim/)
method is that this method does not check if the task already has a user
assigned to it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to set the assignee for.

requestBody.description: Provide the id of the user that will be the assignee of the task.

500.description:
Task with given id does not exist or setting the assignee was not successful.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Gets the attachments for a task.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the attachments for.

404.description:
No task exists for the given task id. See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Creates an attachment for a task.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to add the attachment to.

example-1.description: Post data for a new task attachment.
example-1.value:
------------------------------925df49a954b
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="url"

                        http://my-attachment-content-url.de
                        ------------------------------925df49a954b
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="attachment-name"

                        attachmentName
                        ------------------------------925df49a954b
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="attachment-description"

                        attachmentDescription
                        ------------------------------925df49a954b
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="attachment-type"

                        attachmentType
                        ------------------------------925df49a954b--

400.description:
The task does not exists or task id is null. No content or url to remote content exists. See the
[Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

403.description:
The history of the engine is disabled. See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

delete.description: Removes an attachment from a task by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the attachment to be removed.

403.description:
The history of the engine is disabled. See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
A Task Attachment for the given task id and attachment id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a task attachment by task id and attachment id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the attachment to be retrieved.

404.description:
The attachment for the given task and attachment id does not exist or the history of the engine is
disabled.

See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves the binary content of a task attachment by task id and attachment id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the attachment to be retrieved.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                            responses, the Content-Disposition header will be set.

404.description:
The attachment content for the given task id and attachment id does not exist, or the history of the
engine is disabled.

See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Reports a business error in the context of a running task by id. The error code must
be specified to identify the BPMN error handler. See the documentation for
[Reporting Bpmn Error](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/bpmn20/tasks/user-task/#reporting-bpmn-error)
in User Tasks.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task a BPMN error is reported for.

400.description:
Returned if the `errorCode` or `id` are not present in the request. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to update the task. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Reports an escalation in the context of a running task by id. The escalation code must
be specified to identify the escalation handler. See the documentation for
[Reporting Bpmn Escalation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/bpmn20/tasks/user-task/#reporting-bpmn-escalation)
in User Tasks.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task in which context a BPMN escalation is reported.

400.description: Returned if the escalationCode is not provided in the request. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to update the process instance. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Claims a task for a specific user.

**Note:** The difference with the
[Set Assignee](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/task/post-assignee/)
method is that here a check is performed to see if the task already has a user
assigned to it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to claim.

requestBody.description: Provide the id of the user that claims the task.

500.description:
Task with given id does not exist or claiming was not successful. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Gets the comments for a task by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the comments for.

404.description:
No task exists for the given task id. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Creates a comment for a task by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to add the comment to.

requestBody.description: **Note:** Only the `message` property will be used. Every other property passed to this endpoint will be ignored.

400.description:
The task does not exist or no comment message was submitted. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
The history of the engine is disabled. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a task comment by task id and comment id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: commentId
parameters.description: The id of the comment to be retrieved.

404.description:
The task or comment with given task and comment id does not exist, or the history of
the engine is disabled. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Completes a task and updates process variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to complete.

example-1.description: Complete Task with variables in return

example-2.description: Complete Task without variables in return

200.description: Request successful. The response contains the process variables.

204.description: Request successful. The response contains no variables.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be
resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description: Delegates a task to another user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to delegate.

requestBody.description: Provide the id of the user that the task should be delegated to.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or delegation was not successful. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the deployed form that is referenced from a given task. For further
information please refer to the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/task-forms/#embedded-task-forms).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to get the deployed form for.

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: (e.g. "Great Pizza for Everyone Inc.")

schema.description: For `application/json` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

400.description:
The form key has wrong format. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
The deployed form cannot be retrieved due to missing permissions on task resource.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
No deployed form for a given task exists. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the form key for a task. The form key corresponds to the `FormData#formKey`
property in the engine. This key can be used to do task-specific form rendering in
client applications. Additionally, the context path of the containing process
application is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the form for.

400.description:
Task with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the form variables for a task. The form variables take form data specified
on the task into account. If form fields are defined, the variable types and default
values of the form fields are taken into account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables for.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Gets the identity links for a task by id, which are the users and groups that are in
*some* relation to it (including assignee and owner).

parameters.name: type

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

200.description:
Request successful.

        File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: binary variable: Status 200. Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
            Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

example-1.value: file variable: Status 200. Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="someFile.txt"

400.description:
Variable with given id exists but is not a binary variable.See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

Variable with given id does not exist. See the

for the error response format.

example-1.description: Post binary content of a byte array variable.

```
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff

                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

```

                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"

                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

get.description:
Retrieves the rendered form for a task. This method can be used to get the HTML
rendering of a
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to get the rendered form for.

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.description: A `/task/anId/rendered-form` HTML GET response body providing the rendered (generated) form content.

The task with the given id does not exist or has no form field metadata defined for
this task. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Resolves a task and updates execution variables.

Resolving a task marks that the assignee is done with the task delegated to them, and
that it can be sent back to the owner. Can only be executed when the task has been
delegated. The assignee will be set to the owner, who performed the delegation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to resolve.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be
resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Completes a task and updates process variables using a form submit. There are two
difference between this method and the `complete` method:

* If the task is in state `PENDING` - i.e., has been delegated before, it is not
completed but resolved. Otherwise it will be completed.
* If the task has Form Field Metadata defined, the process engine will perform backend
validation for any form fields which have validators defined.
See the
[Generated Task Forms](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/task-forms/_index/#generated-task-forms)
section of the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/) for more information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to submit the form for.

example-1.description: Response of a submitted task form with variables in return

200.description: Request successful. The response contains the process variables.

204.description: Request successful. The response contains no variables.

the error response format.

get.description:
Query for a list of tenants using a list of parameters. The size of the result set
can be retrieved by using the [Get Tenant
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/tenant/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the tenant.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: userMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given user is a member of.

parameters.name: groupMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given group is a member of.

parameters.name: includingGroupsOfUser
parameters.description:
Select only tenants where the user or one of his groups is a member of.
Can only be used in combination with the `userMember` parameter. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy` is specified. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

options.description:
The `/tenant` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, this one for the resource
as such and one for individual tenant instances. The OPTIONS request
allows checking for the set of available operations that the currently
authenticated user can perform on the `/tenant` resource. If the user
can perform an operation or not may depend on various things,
including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

get.description: Query for tenants using a list of parameters and retrieves the count.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the tenant.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: userMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given user is a member of.

parameters.name: groupMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given group is a member of.

parameters.name: includingGroupsOfUser
parameters.description:
Select only tenants where the user or one of his groups is a member of.
Can only be used in combination with the `userMember` parameter. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

options.description:
The `/tenant` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, one for the resource as such and this one for
individual tenant instances. The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that
the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/tenant/{id}` resource. If the user can perform an
operation or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations to interact with this
resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

options.description:
The `/user` resource supports two custom `OPTIONS` requests, one for the resource as such
and one for individual user instances. The `OPTIONS` request allows checking for the set of
available operations that the currently authenticated user can perform on the /user resource.
If the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various things, including the user's
authorizations to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process
engine. `OPTIONS /user` returns available interactions on the resource.

get.description:
Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the
properties of variable instances, such as the name or type. The size
of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get Variable Instance
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the variable instance name. The parameter can include the wildcard `%` to
express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or
contains (`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case instance ids.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated task
ids.

parameters.name: batchIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
batch ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variableValues
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances that have the certain values.
Value filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableName** and **variablename** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to
`true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters through a JSON object.
This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get Variable Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/variable-
instance/get-query/) method because it allows filtering by multiple
variable instances of types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults

Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:

get.description: Retrieves a variable by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:**  While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the content of a variable by id. Applicable for byte array and file
variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

200.description:
Request successful. For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
                      File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                      variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                            responses, the Content-Disposition header will be set.

400.description:
Variable with given id exists but does not serialize as binary data. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves the version of the Rest API.

example-1.description: The Response content of a status 200

absoluteRemovalTime.description:
The date for which the instances shall be removed. Value may not be `null`.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `clearedRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

clearedRemovalTime.description:
Sets the removal time to `null`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

calculatedRemovalTime.description:
The removal time is calculated based on the engine's configuration settings. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `clearedRemovalTime`.

ActivityInstanceDto.description: A JSON object corresponding to the Activity Instance tree of the given process instance.

id.description: The id of the activity instance.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

activityType.description: The type of activity (corresponds to the XML element name in the BPMN 2.0, e.g., 'userTask')

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance this activity instance is part of.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

childActivityInstances.description: A list of child activity instances.

childTransitionInstances.description:
A list of child transition instances.
A transition instance represents an execution waiting in an asynchronous continuation.

incidents.description:
A list of JSON objects containing incident specific properties:
* `id`: the id of the incident
* `activityId`: the activity id in which the incident occurred

id.description: The id of the incident.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The activity id in which the incident happened.

id.description: The id of the activity the results are aggregated for.

instances.description: The total number of running process instances of this activity.

failedJobs.description:
The total number of failed jobs for the running instances.
**Note**: Will be `0` (not `null`), if failed jobs were excluded.

incidents.description:
Each item in the resulting array is an object which contains `incidentType` and `incidentCount`.
**Note**: Will be an empty array, if `incidents` or `incidentsForType` were excluded.
Furthermore, the array will be also empty if no incidents were found.

rel.description: The relation of the link to the object that belongs to.

id.description: The id of the task attachment.

name.description: The name of the task attachment.

description.description: The description of the task attachment.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the attachment belongs.

type.description:
Indication of the type of content that this attachment refers to.
Can be MIME type or any other indication.

url.description: The url to the remote content of the task attachment.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the attachment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process containing the task.

isAuthenticated.description: A flag indicating if user is authenticated.

userId.description: The id of the user that does not have expected permissions

id.description: The id of the batch.

type.description:
The type of the batch.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

totalJobs.description: The total jobs of a batch is the number of batch execution jobs required to complete the batch.

jobsCreated.description: The number of batch execution jobs already created by the seed job.

batchJobsPerSeed.description:
The number of batch execution jobs created per seed job invocation.
The batch seed job is invoked until it has created all batch execution jobs required by the batch
(see `totalJobs` property).

invocationsPerBatchJob.description:
Every batch execution job invokes the command executed by the batch `invocationsPerBatchJob` times.
E.g., for a process instance migration batch this specifies the number of process instances which are migrated per batch execution job.

seedJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the seed jobs of this batch.

monitorJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the monitor jobs of this batch.

batchJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the batch execution jobs of this batch.

suspended.description: Indicates whether this batch is suspended or not.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the batch.

createUserId.description: The id of the user that created the batch.

remainingJobs.description:
The number of remaining batch execution jobs. This does include failed batch execution jobs and
batch execution jobs which still have to be created by the seed job.

completedJobs.description: The number of completed batch execution jobs. This does include aborted/deleted batch execution jobs.

failedJobs.description: The number of failed batch execution jobs. This does not include aborted or deleted batch execution jobs.

id.description: The id of the case definition

key.description: The key of the case definition, i.e., the id of the CMMN 2.0 XML case definition.

category.description: The category of the case definition.

name.description: The name of the case definition.

version.description: The version of the case definition that the engine assigned to it.

resource.description: The file name of the case definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the case definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the case definition.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the case definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

valid.description: `true` if the password is compliant with the policy, otherwise `false`.
`true` if the password is compliant with this rule, otherwise `false`.

id.description: The id of the task comment.

userId.description: The id of the user who created the comment.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the comment belongs.

time.description:
The time when the comment was created.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the comment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing the task.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

withVariablesInReturn.description:
Indicates whether the response should contain the process variables or not. The
default is `false` with a response code of `204`. If set to `true` the response
contains the process variables and has a response code of `200`. If the task is not
associated with a process instance (e.g. if it's part of a case instance) no
variables will be returned.

value.description: The variable value, could be of type boolean, string or number

messageName.description: The name of the message to deliver.

businessKey.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Will only correlate to executions that belong to a process instance with the provided business key.

tenantId.description:
Used to correlate the message for a tenant with the given id.
Will only correlate to executions and process definitions which belong to the tenant.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `withoutTenantId`.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should only be correlated to executions
and process definitions which belong to no tenant or not. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `tenantId`.

processInstanceId.description: Used to correlate the message to the process instance with the given id.

correlationKeys.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against process instance variables
during correlation. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the
following properties.

localCorrelationKeys.description:
Local variables used for correlation of executions (process instances) that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against local variables during correlation.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

processVariables.description:
A map of variables that is injected into the triggered execution or process instance after the message
has been delivered. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with
the following properties.

processVariablesLocal.description:
A map of local variables that is injected into the triggered execution or process instance after the
message has been delivered. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object
with the following properties.

all.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should be correlated to exactly one entity or multiple entities.
If the value is set to `false`, the message will be correlated to exactly one entity (execution or process definition).
If the value is set to `true`, the message will be correlated to multiple executions and a process definition that
can be instantiated by this message in one go.

resultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should be returned or not.
If this property is set to `true`, there will be returned a list of message correlation result objects. Depending on the
all property, there will be either one ore more returned results in the list.

The default value is `false`, which means no result will be returned.

variablesInResultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should contain process variables or not.
The parameter resultEnabled should be set to `true` in order to use this it.

The default value is `false`, which means the variables will not be returned.

incidentType.description: A type of the new incident.

configuration.description: A configuration for the new incident.

message.description: A message for the new incident.

id.description: The id of the decision definition.

dmnXml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this decision definition was deployed with.
Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks are escaped.

id.description: The id of the decision definition

key.description: The key of the decision definition, i.e., the id of the DMN 1.0 XML decision definition.

category.description: The category of the decision definition.

name.description: The name of the decision definition.

version.description: The version of the decision definition that the engine assigned to it.

resource.description: The file name of the decision definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision definition.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the decision definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

versionTag.description: The version tag of the decision definition.

id.description: The id of the decision requirements definition

key.description: The key of the decision requirements definition, i.e., the id of the DMN 1.0 XML decision definition.

name.description: The name of the decision requirements definition.

category.description: The category of the decision requirements definition.

version.description: The version of the decision requirements definition that the engine assigned to it.

resource.description: The file name of the decision requirements definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision requirements definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decisionrequirements definition.

historicProcessInstanceIds.description: A list historic process instance ids to delete.

failIfNotExists.description: If set to `false`, the request will still be successful if one ore more of the process ids are not found.

processInstanceIds.description: A list process instance ids to delete.

skipCustomListeners.description: Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

skipSubprocesses.description: Skip deletion of the subprocesses related to deleted processes as part of this request.

id.description: The id of the deployment.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the deployment.

deploymentTime.description: The time when the deployment was created.

DeploymentResourceDto.title: DeploymentResourceDto
DeploymentResourceDto.description:
A JSON object corresponding to the `Resource` interface in the engine.
Its properties are as follows:

id.description: The id of the deployment resource.

name.description: The name of the deployment resource

deployedProcessDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the process definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the process definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the process definition.

deployedDecisionDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision definition.

deployedDecisionRequirementsDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision requirements definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision requirements definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision requirements definition.

deployedCaseDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the case definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the case definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the case definition.

period.description:
Specifies a timespan within a year.
**Note:** The period must be interpreted in conjunction with the returned `periodUnit`.

periodUnit.description: The unit of the given period. Possible values are `MONTH` and `QUARTER`.

minimum.description: The smallest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

maximum.description: The greatest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

average.description: The average duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

variables.description:
A map of variables which are used for evaluation of the conditions and are injected into the process instances which have been triggered.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

businessKey.description: Used for the process instances that have been triggered after the evaluation.

tenantId.description:
Used to evaluate a condition for a tenant with the given id.
Will only evaluate conditions of process definitions which belong to the tenant.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the conditions should only be evaluated of process definitions which belong to no tenant or not.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

processDefinitionId.description: Used to evaluate conditions of the process definition with the given id.

id.description: The id of the event subscription.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

createdDate.description: The time this event subscription was created.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this event subscription belongs to.
Can be `null` if the subscription belongs to no single tenant.

EventSubscriptionQueryDto.description: A event subscription query which retrieves a list of event subscriptions

eventSubscriptionId.description: The id of the event subscription.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
Only select subscriptions that belong to one of the given tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only select subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

includeEventSubscriptionsWithoutTenantId.description:
Select event subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Can be used in combination with tenantIdIn parameter.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

type.description: An exception class indicating the occurred error.

message.description: A detailed message of the error.

id.description: The id of the Execution.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the root of the execution tree representing the process instance.

ended.description: Indicates if the execution is ended.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this execution belongs to. Can be `null`
if the execution belongs to no single tenant.

ExecutionQueryDto.description: A Execution instance query which defines a list of Execution instances

businessKey.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

signalEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

messageEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

active.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

suspended.description:
Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

incidentType.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

incidentMessage.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

incidentMessageLike.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a  list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

variables.description:
An array to only include executions that have variables with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.

processVariables.description:
An array to only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables
with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Has no effect for the `/count` endpoint

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

variables.description:
A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and
each value a JSON variable value object.

newDuration.description:
An amount of time (in milliseconds). This is the new lock duration starting from the
current moment.

workerId.description:
The id of the worker that reports the failure. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently
locked the task.

ExternalTaskDto.title: ExternalTaskDto
ExternalTaskDto.description: An External Task object with the following properties

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this external task belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that the external task belongs to.

errorMessage.description:
The full error message submitted with the latest reported failure executing this task; `null` if no
failure was reported previously or if no error message was submitted

executionId.description: The id of the execution that the external task belongs to.

id.description: The id of the external task.

lockExpirationTime.description: The date that the task's most recent lock expires or has expired.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: The version tag of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the external task belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant the external task belongs to.

retries.description: The number of retries the task currently has left.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the external task is suspended or not.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posesses or posessed the most recent lock.

topicName.description: The topic name of the external task.

priority.description: The priority of the external task.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance the external task belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An message indicating the reason of the failure.

retries.description:
A number of how often the task should be retried. Must be >= 0. If this is 0, an incident is created and
the task cannot be fetched anymore unless the retries are increased again. The incident's message is set
to the `errorMessage` parameter.

retryTimeout.description: A timeout in milliseconds before the external task becomes available again for fetching. Must be >= 0.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

ExternalTaskQueryDto.title: ExternalTaskQueryDto
ExternalTaskQueryDto.description: A JSON object with the following properties:

externalTaskId.description: Filter by an external task's id.

externalTaskIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

topicName.description: Filter by an external task topic.

workerId.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

locked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

notLocked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

withRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

noRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

lockExpirationAfter.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

lockExpirationBefore.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.15/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity that an external task is created for.

activityIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of ids of the activities that an external task is created for.

executionId.description: Filter by the id of the execution that an external task belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance that an external task belongs to.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids that an external task may belong to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the id of the process definition that an external task belongs to.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
An external task must have one of the given tenant ids.

active.description: Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

suspended.description: Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is a JSON object that
                    specifies one ordering. The position in the array identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether
                    it is primary, secondary, etc. The ordering objects have the following properties:

                    **Note:** The `sorting` properties will not be applied to the External Task count query.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

lockDuration.description: **Mandatory.** The duration to lock the external tasks for in milliseconds.

variables.description:
A JSON array of `String` values that represent variable names. For each result task belonging to this
topic, the given variables are returned as well if they are accessible from the external task's
execution. If not provided - all variables will be fetched.

localVariables.description: If `true` only local variables will be fetched.

businessKey.description: A `String` value which enables the filtering of tasks based on process instance business key.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter tasks based on process definition id.

processDefinitionIdIn.description: Filter tasks based on process definition ids.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter tasks based on process definition key.
